item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the Gap at the Carriage Servo Pulley Bearing
item.description: During the restoration of a Beogram 4000 turntable, significant longitudinal play was discovered in the threaded rod responsible for moving the carriage. This play resulted in a ‘clacking’ noise whenever the carriage changed direction. The issue was resolved by removing the servo pulley, damaged locking ring, and worn plastic washer. A new, thick 2-56 nylon washer, which fit snugly on the shaft, replaced the locking ring and washer. The locking ring became unnecessary as the pulley was secured with a setscrew.

item.title: Beogram 4002: Conversion of the Tracking Sensor Light Bulb to an LED and Adjustment of the Sensor
item.description: I began repairing a Beogram 4002 turntable that I purchased from Craigslist a year ago. I saw it as a good warm-up project before tackling the restoration of my prized Beogram 6000 4-Channel turntable. When I plugged in the Beogram 4002, hoping for the best but prepared for potential issues, nothing happened except for the complete absence of tracking. The tonearm wouldn’t lower, and there were signs of previous repair attempts.
